facts.fact: Dogs have a very strong sense of smell, up to 10,000 to 100,000 times more sensitive than that of humans.
Dogs are known for their loyalty to their owners. They bond strongly with humans and feel secure in their presence.
There are more than 340 different dog breeds worldwide, each with unique characteristics and traits.
Dogs communicate not only by barking but also with their tail. The way they wag their tail can express emotions like joy, fear, or uncertainty.
Dogs have a sense of time and can estimate durations, such as waiting for their owners.
Many dog breeds are natural hunters. They have a well-developed instinct to detect and chase prey.
Dogs are social animals that thrive in packs. They do well in the company of other dogs and humans.
Dogs have excellent hearing and can perceive sounds at frequencies much higher than what humans can hear.
Dogs vary greatly in size, from small breeds like Chihuahuas to large breeds like the Great Dane, with enormous differences in physical traits.
Many dogs enjoy swimming and are good swimmers. Some breeds, like the Labrador Retriever, are naturally drawn to water.
